result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jacob E. Caruso in court appeared late. Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. MFAC granted. Court will hold finding of payment at this time. Defendant sworn by clerk. Court reviews paperwork with Defendant. Case should be a Misdemeanor not felony. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

9:28 AM Case called. Defendant Jacob E. Caruso in court. Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court.
Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office. 
Status set for May 24, 2022 @ 8:30am, 3036

Defendant Jacob E Caruso in court. JJ Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bond remains. ADA needs to speak to the victim. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money
Signed bond filed with the court.

DEFENDANT MUST POST $500 CASH

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): C.F.C. dob 10-9-1969 OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Jacob E Caruso in court, in custody by video. Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared. Defendant does not qualify for SPD.  State asking for cash component, Defense asking for straight signature. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
